poem:
Title: "Chart-Topping Auteur"

A southern voice in the north,
Jazz hummingbird now a pop phoenix,
Wearing the hat of many stars.
Her words, whispers in the ears of queens - 
Beyoncé, Adele, Rihanna's siren song.

Maturity's crown blooms in platinum.
Pop's darling, over forty, and yet in ascent,
Like a motley meteor, 
The uncommon sky is her canvas,
Our night listens, changed.
